challenges.title: Why teams struggle with UX writing
challenges.subtitle: If your interface copy feels inconsistent or confusing, it's often not because the writers aren't good. It's because the process isn't built to support good writing.

challenge-1.title: Microcopy is treated as an afterthought
challenge-1.description: Microcopy is often added after design decisions are made. Chordio brings writing into the design process, so you can catch and fix wording issues early.

challenge-2.title: Writers lack shared standards and guardrails
challenge-2.description: Tone and terminology drift across products and features. Chordio applies consistent rules for language, tone, and voice across your product.

challenge-3.title: Copy reviews happen in spreadsheets, not designs
challenge-3.description: Copy is reviewed in docs or spreadsheets, not inside the design. Chordio reviews words where they appear â€” inside Figma frames or live web pages.

challenge-4.title: Varying UX writing proficiency across contributors
challenge-4.description: As teams grow, it's hard to maintain consistency and accessibility across every message. Chordio automates checks for clarity, tone, and inclusivity so nothing slips through.

benefits.title: Check your copy against proven UX writing principles
benefits.subtitle: Chordio checks your designs against proven UX writing principles, helping you spot unclear phrasing, tone mismatches, and moments that break user flow.

benefit-1.title: Clarity
benefit-1.description: Write like you speak. Users shouldn't need to think twice. Catch phrases like 'Re-compute settings' that leave users unsure what happens next.

benefit-2.title: Conciseness
benefit-2.description: Keep it short. Every word should earn its place. Identify long tooltips or help text that explain more than they need to.

benefit-3.title: Consistency
benefit-3.description: Use the same terms and tone across screens. Spot when 'Delete' on one screen becomes 'Remove' on another â€” users hesitate.

benefit-4.title: Empathy
benefit-4.description: Anticipate confusion. Offer guidance, not blame. Transform 'You entered the wrong code' into 'That code didn't work. Try again.'

benefit-5.title: Action Orientation
benefit-5.description: Help users know what to do next. Replace vague buttons like 'Proceed' with clear ones like 'Save and continue'.

benefit-6.title: Accessibility
benefit-6.description: Use language that everyone can understand. Avoid overly complex instructions or insider jargon that exclude users.

faq.title: Common questions
faq.subtitle: Learn how Chordio helps teams write better UX copy

question-1.question: How does Chordio review my copy?
question-1.answer: Chordio analyzes your interface copy against proven UX writing principles like clarity, conciseness, and consistency. It highlights issues and suggests improvements directly in context.

question-2.question: Does it work with my design tools?
question-2.answer: Yes. Chordio integrates with Figma and works as a browser extension for reviewing live websites. Review copy wherever it lives, without context switching.

question-3.question: Can I customize the writing standards?
question-3.answer: Absolutely. Define your brand voice, approved terminology, and style guidelines. Chordio applies your rules consistently across all reviews.

question-4.question: Can my entire team use Chordio?
question-4.answer: Yes. Chordio is designed for teams. Designers, writers, and product managers can all review copy, share feedback, and maintain consistent standards.

question-5.question: How quickly can I start using it?
question-5.answer: Install the Figma plugin or browser extension and start reviewing in minutes. No training requiredâ€”Chordio's feedback is clear and actionable from day one.
